summary: Tested Grace Period Configuration Feature for Reserved Member Auto-Cleanup. All 19 backend tests passed (100%). Frontend UI tests passed - form displays correctly, add/remove product overrides work, save updates configuration, preview shows correct statistics.
passed_tests: Backend: GET /api/reserved-members/cleanup-config requires authentication (401/403)
Backend: PUT /api/reserved-members/cleanup-config requires authentication (401/403)
Backend: GET cleanup-config requires admin role (staff gets 403)
Backend: PUT cleanup-config requires admin role (staff gets 403)
Backend: GET cleanup-config returns correct structure (global_grace_days, warning_days, product_overrides, available_products)
Backend: GET cleanup-config returns available products with id and name
Backend: GET cleanup-config returns sensible default values
Backend: PUT cleanup-config updates configuration successfully
Backend: PUT cleanup-config validates grace_days >= 1
Backend: PUT cleanup-config validates warning_days >= 1
Backend: PUT cleanup-config validates warning_days < global_grace_days
Backend: Can add product-specific grace period override
Backend: Product override validates product_id exists
Backend: Product override validates grace_days >= 1
Backend: Can add multiple product overrides
Backend: Preview endpoint returns config info being used
Backend: Preview member info includes grace_days used
Backend: Cleanup runs successfully with current config
Backend: Config change affects preview results
Frontend: Grace Period Settings form displays current configuration
Frontend: Add Product button adds product override row
Frontend: Remove button removes product override
Frontend: Save button updates configuration with success toast
Frontend: How it works section dynamically updates with current values
Frontend: Preview Cleanup shows correct statistics
seed_data_creation: None - used existing data. Current state: 10 approved reserved members, 3 with OMSET (active), 0 expiring soon, 0 to be deleted.
context_for_next_testing_agent: Grace Period Configuration feature fully tested. Endpoints: GET /api/reserved-members/cleanup-config (returns config with available_products), PUT /api/reserved-members/cleanup-config (updates config with validation). Config stored in MongoDB collection 'reserved_member_config'. Preview endpoint at GET /api/scheduled-reports/reserved-member-cleanup-preview now returns config being used. Each reserved member's grace period can be different based on product_id matching product_overrides, otherwise global_grace_days is used. Warning notifications are sent when days_remaining <= warning_days. Frontend section is at bottom of Scheduled Reports page with data-testid attributes for all interactive elements.
